definition: dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: In fact, there was no revisionism in China.
sentences.chinese: 实际上中国并没有修正主义上台。

sentences.english: Revisionism is one form of bourgeois ideology.
sentences.chinese: 修正主义是一种资产阶级思想。

sentences.english: They will also give rise to the result of historical revisionism .
sentences.chinese: 这些因素共同作用也会形成历史修正主义的结果。

sentences.english: Thisis what I read in my revisionist history book. Kinzo wantanabe.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我从修正主义的历史书中所读到的内容。

sentences.english: The reputation of the navigator is under assault from historical revisionists.
sentences.chinese: 这位航海家的名誉受到了历史修正主义者的攻击。

sentences.english: The Western re-invented itself in the revisionist Western.
sentences.chinese: 在修正主义西部片中，西部电影完成了自我改造。

sentences.english: Both dogmatism and revisionism run counter to Marxism.
sentences.chinese: 于是，特权阶层将转变为修正主义集团。

sentences.english: We gave up on one or two who were too far gone , they were died - in - the - wool revisionists.
sentences.chinese: 我们放弃了一两个走得太远的陷入修正主义的人。
我们是天生的修正主义者。

sentences.english: Lenin was already a "revisionist" by the early 1900s.
sentences.chinese: 列宁在1900年代早期已经是一个“修正主义”了。

definition: capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
